attributes.action: Initiate a reinforced disinfection plan across public transport in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The number of COVID-19 cases (and deaths) in the UK is growing by the minute. Less than 3 years ago researchers from London Metropolitan University found 9 of the world’s most dangerous superbugs through swabs on the London Tube (121 different bacteria and moulds in total). Urgent action is needed, with an effective, comprehensive and regular disinfection plan ensuring the highest level of safety and hygiene to all citizens and visitors using public transport vehicles in the country.
attributes.background: Given the global emergency linked to COVID-19 and the amount of daily passengers using public transport in the UK, we ask the Government to imminently initiate a permanent and effective disinfection plan, ensuring the highest level of hygiene whilst mitigating contamination risks at best.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise.
Responsibility for local public transport is devolved to local councils or Mayors, and national public transport is the responsibility of individual transport operators.
